docs.lead_paragraph: Top U.S. hedge fund management firms, including Dan Loeb's Third Point LLC, took new positions in Morgan Stanley during the fourth quarter, ahead of the bank's cost-cutting measures and bond-management reshuffling.

headline.main: Top U.S. Hedge Funds Bet on Morgan Stanley and AIG
headline.print_headline: Top U.S. Hedge Funds Bet on Morgan Stanley and AIG

docs.snippet: Top U.S. hedge fund management firms, including Dan Loeb's Third Point LLC, took new positions in Morgan Stanley during the fourth quarter, ahead of the bank's cost-cutting measures and bond-management reshuffling.

docs.lead_paragraph: William Stiritz, one of the largest investors in Herbalife Ltd, cut his stake in the nutrition and weight loss company to 5.2 percent, down from 8.2 percent, according to a regulatory filing on Tuesday.

headline.main: Stiritz Cuts Stake in Herbalife to 5.2 Percent: Filing
headline.print_headline: Stiritz Cuts Stake in Herbalife to 5.2 Percent: Filing

docs.snippet: William Stiritz, one of the largest investors in Herbalife Ltd, cut his stake in the nutrition and weight loss company to 5.2 percent, down from 8.2 percent, according to a regulatory filing on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Agriculture Department unveiled new rules on Tuesday that would force retailers who accept food stamps to stock a wider variety of healthy foods or face the loss of business as consumers shop elsewhere.

headline.main: USDA Rules Would Increase Food Stamp Access to Healthy Foods
headline.print_headline: USDA Rules Would Increase Food Stamp Access to Healthy Foods

docs.snippet: The Agriculture Department unveiled new rules on Tuesday that would force retailers who accept food stamps to stock a wider variety of healthy foods or face the loss of business as consumers shop elsewhere.

docs.lead_paragraph: Poor families can’t afford to experiment with picky eaters.

headline.main: A Hidden Cost to Giving Kids Their Vegetables
headline.print_headline: A Hidden Cost to Giving Kids Their Vegetables

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Caitlin Daniel uses her research on how parents choose to feed their children to shed light on how children's finicky eating habits have particular impact on lower-income families; notes poor parents cannot afford waste caused by children's rejection of food and end up buying items that are less nutritious or healthful.
docs.snippet: Poor families can’t afford to experiment with picky eaters.

docs.lead_paragraph: The oft-repeated 10-to-1 ratio of microbes to human cells was unrealistic, researchers say. The numbers of microbes and human cells are about the same.

headline.main: 40 Trillion Bacteria on and in Us? Fewer Than We Thought.
headline.print_headline: 40 Trillion Bacteria on and in Us? Fewer Than We Thought.

docs.abstract: Study in journal Cell concludes human microbiome contains close to 40 trillion bacterial cells, number close to amount of human cells and far lower than has been proposed by other studies.
docs.snippet: The oft-repeated 10-to-1 ratio of microbes to human cells was unrealistic, researchers say. The numbers of microbes and human cells are about the same.

headline.main: Organic Meat and Milk Higher in Healthful Fatty Acids
headline.print_headline: More Nutrients, but Still Health Questions

docs.abstract: The question of whether differences in some nutrients compared with conventionally produced food are likely to translate to better health is disputed.
docs.snippet: The question of whether differences in some nutrients compared with conventionally produced food are likely to translate to better health is disputed.
